children.subject:
I'm unable to respond to that other than to commend your creative thinking. :-)

Seriously, (and I will say this a few times on this thread, no doubt) webcasting is at the discretion of faculty. I have no insight about why this class is not being webcast.

Is it possible to evade the fire code by providing audio recording? The audio could be playing classical guitar music for all we care. Most people don't attend lecture (me included  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ ) We can then inform students the class is only audio recorded, and allow them to decide whether they want to stay or not.

Or, we can combine the classical guitar music and Titanic movie and claim we made webcast. 

 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Thanks.

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize that you've fulfilled the discrete math req since you took math 55.
You'll receive an update when we have one.

I just received the email that says I am within the pool of 90 students who will potentially have to be unenrolled and moved to the top of the waitlist. I have a question about the qualification of selecting those 90 students. As far as I understood, students who are not senior and/ or do not completed prerequisites. If so, the only reason I can think of that I am in the pool of 90 students is that I am double majoring in CS and Applied math and I took Math 55 instead of CS 70 since I am senior as of 2018 Fall and completed Math 53 and Math 54. If this is indeed the case, I don't think I should be considered as not completed the prerequisites since CS department approved that I took the equivalent class of CS 70. If not, I'll just accept my fate and cross the finger. I hope my doubt can be cleared. Thanks!
Please email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu or eecs-advising@eecs.berkeley.edu depending on your major with your SID.

I am a rising junior who did not take 54, but instead, I have Math 110 and Math 105, which together I think cover most of 54. Does that mean that I am at the risk of being dropped? I am very concerned, please let me know.

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize your Math 53 course since it was fulfilled in a different way.
You'll receive an update when we have one.

I received the email that said I haven't completed all the prerequisites; however, I double-checked and I actually have, although I took Math 53 at a community college. In any case, I've completed all the pre-reqs -- did I possibly receive the email by mistake?

From what I know equivalencies from other colleges are reviewed on a case-by-case basis. Please email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu or eecs-advising@eecs.berkeley.edu depending on your major with your SID.
In general, do the prerequisites have to have been taken at Berkeley? Or does an equivalent course elsewhere also count as having satisfied that prereq?
Responded to email.

I also received the email that says I am within the pool of 90 students as well. I am confused because I have taken Math 53, EE 16A and EE 16B, and CS 70 all here at Berkeley. My email is julialuo@berkeley.edu, could somebody look at this? I can send you my transcript if that is necessary. I just need to know soon so I can decide whether to switch into another class.

Kevin, I very much appreciate your willingness to help alleviate this situation. Your community spirit is commendable.

Webcasting is at faculty discretion and I have no insight into why this class is not being webcast. You may want to contact the instructor(s) with your offer.
Please do if allowed! I am sure all the students would be willing to help offset any relevant costs in doing so as well!

I'm a student who has experience recording lectures and events for the EECS department. I'm willing to record CS 189 to make everyone's life easier; nobody wants what's happening and it's obviously an unfair nightmare for many (I really can't imagine the administrative nightmare this is already). Email me at kamcbk@berkeley.edu. I'm serious, let's talk!

We are sorting out the current waitlist situation right now. I know it is frustrating to wait for information, but we want to make sure we are being as fair as possible to everyone. When I know more, I will post about the wait list either tonight or tomorrow.

How does this situation impact students who are on the waitlist yet have completed all the prereqs and are seniors? Given that all the criteria is met for such students, would they have preference to get off the waitlist?

Forgive the repeat but I want to try to respond to each post if possible.

Webcasting is at the discretion of faculty. I have no insight about why this class is not being webcast.

Hi Cindy,

Last spring in EECS 127 professor El Ghaoui initially informed us that he only had audio webcast capabilities for the lecture, as in the only equipment that was provided was a clip-on microphone. He later was able to screen cast his notes on an iPad but that's not important.

As the other responder said, is it not even possible to provide an audio recording of the lecture? My understanding is that Li Ka Shing has had webcasted lectures before, so it's not like it lacks the equipment capavility for it. The microphone does not require active operation like a cameraman would. 

Was the decision made because of some other factors that we don't know about, like the instructors deciding against webcasting, or a shortage of mics, or some sort of arbitrary requirement that classes in LKS have to be video webcasted? I'm confused that after "doing all you can to mitigate impact to students" that it was not possible to choose a less disruptive solution, given that there was already precedent for audio-only webcasts.

We appreciate the transparency in detailing how 90 poor unfortunate souls have been culled from the class, but I think we also should see more transparency or how the staff arrived at this decision as well.

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize your Math 53 course since it was fulfilled in a different way.
You'll receive an update when we have one.

I received the email saying that I am one of the 90 students as well. I think the only reason is because I haven't taken math 53. However, this is only because I had equivalent coursework in high school, and I petitioned the eecs department to let me take 104 instead, which I took last semester. I don't understand why i should be waitlisted.
Don't think so.
Is there somewhere to see on calcentral when we enrolled in the class?
to be more specific, I took W53 instead of 53, in case that’s the issue
Responded to email.
I’ve already completed ee16b, ee16a, and cs70, and I just completed Math53 as part of summer session. Did I get the email by mistake (since Math53 would show up as “in progress” and not complete)?

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize your Math 53 course since you took Math W53.
You'll receive an update when we have one.
I also received the email saying I am in the pool of 90 students, but I have fulfilled all of the prerequisites.  (I took MATHW53 instead of MATH53).  Thanks!
I've added you to the list. Please send documentation of approval of the high school credit for Math 53 to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu

I also received the email and took the equivalent of 53 in high school. I've fulfilled all the other prereqs here at Berkeley. Can I be added to the list of students who have fulfilled the prereqs? Thanks

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize your Math 53 course since it was fulfilled in a different way.
You'll receive an update when we have one.
Hi, I've received the email but have all the prerequisites. (Took MATHW53 instead of MATH53). Would appreciate an advisor's response to this as well, thank you!

There were a series of discussions that took place within the department that included the instructor(s) regarding this matter.

My best recommendation is that you contact the instructor(s) if you have concerns about the lack of webcasting.
Are the faculty aware of the effect of their decision to not webcast the class?

Thanks for following up. I've added you to a list of students who have fulfilled the prerequisites. The report that was pulled didn't automatically recognize your Math 53 course since you took Math W53.
You'll receive an update when we have one.
To advisors, I've received the 90-students email but have all the prerequisites. (Took MATHW53 instead of MATH53). Please add me to the list of students that have fulfilled all prerequisites. Thanks!
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu.

Hi, I received the email notifying me that I am in the pool of students slated to be unenrolled. I have taken Math 54 and CS 70 at Berkeley, but took an equivalent course (Multivariable Calculus) to Math 53, offered by my high school. I see that you previously responded to a person in a similar situation by requesting documentation for approval of the high school credit for Math 53 and I was just wondering, would it somehow be possible for me to obtain such approval? Specifically, I'm a bit concerned about the distinction between having taken a course offered by my high school versus one offered by a local community college. Thanks!
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
Hi, I was dropped from the class when I have taken the equivalent of Math 53, Math 54, and CS 70 (Math 55) and I enrolled in the class last semester with no issue.
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
am working on responding privately to student
Hi, I've taken all the prerequisites (took Math H53 instead of Math 53) but I'm added to the waitlist. Would appreciate an advisor's response. Thanks!
I just responded to your email. Please take into account that we're off during the weekend.
responded privately to student

I've taken all of the prerequisites (with equivalents from community college which the math department accepted) and sent an email to cs advising yesterday, but never received a response. I instead received notification of being moved to the waitlist. I would appreciate knowing if the former was taken into account prior to me being moved. Thanks.
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
responded privately to student

Hi, I have taken all of the prerequisites (I took Math W53 instead of Math 53) but I was added to the waitlist. Would greatly appreciate if an advisor can add me to the list of students who have completed the prerequisites. Thanks.

"no further students will be accepted onto the wait list for the class" (top of this post)

From my understanding, no.
No it is not possible. There are just too many students for the seats available. Please see post @7456 for links to previous semesters' class notes and webcasts.

Is it not possible to even waitlist the course during adjustment period? I'm one of the students who was purged from the course, but tried waitlisting again and the "waitlist if class is full" option is no longer available. Please help if possible!
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
Is Math 55 considered equivalent for the CS70 prerequisite like it generally is for Math / CS double majors?
Please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
Will do, thank you!
responded privately to student

Hello I was moved onto the waitlist but I believe I have met the prereqs, the only thing that I can think of is that I took 53 over the summer as w53. Does this not count as the multivariable requirement?
sad reax, please contact cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu
I was moved to the waitlist but I'm a rising senior with all the prereqs.
I have responded to you privately.

Hi CS Advisors, 

I was moved to the waitlist and have taken all the prerequisites required for CS 189. I also took the equivalent of Math 53 (Multivariable Calculus) in high school in 10th Grade (which has been certified by the Math Department and by my Engineering Student Services advisor Olivia Chan to be equivalent to Berkeley's Math 53), and have fulfilled all the other classes (Math 54, EE16A, and EE 16B). I will now email cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu to please request reenrollment into the course. 

Thank You.

history.content:
As you may have already heard, CS 189 is NOT going to be webcast in F18 as we had originally thought. Due to fire code limitations, we are unable to enroll more students in the class than room capacity allows.

The result is that CS 189 is now over-enrolled by appx 90 students and no further students will be accepted onto the wait list for the class. Students enrolled in this class have already been contacted with detailed information about next steps. We have offered to help students who are at risk of being bumped to the waitlist find an alternate class.

Prerequisite courses for CS 189

Before getting into details about how we determined whom to unenroll, let’s first review the prerequisites for this class. ALL of the following courses are pre-reqs for CS 189:

  • Math 53

  • Math 54 (for which we will continue to accept EE 16 A or B as equivalent)

  • CS 70

How we decided whom to potentially move to the waitlist

According to the Registrar’s office, students can be unenrolled (dropped) from a class if they do not meet the course prerequisites. Accordingly, we are bound to consider who has or has not completed all prerequisites for CS 189. In an effort to limit impact on students, we have opted to unenroll/move students to the top of the waitlist rather than completely drop them from the class.

In the spirit of transparency, we wanted to share with you the criteria that was used to determine whom to unenroll from the class back to the top of the waitlist for CS 189.

  1. We identified people who had NOT fulfilled all the stated prerequisites for this course.

  2. From this pool of students, all non-seniors will be moved to the top of the waitlist in the same order in which they enrolled (someone who enrolled on April 16th will have a better position on the waitlist than someone who enrolled on April 30th).

  3. Within the pool of people who have not met all prerequisites, and to the extent that seniors have to be moved, we will go by enrollment date – most recently enrolled will be the first moved to the waitlist. As with others, if you enrolled on 4/16, you will appear higher on the waitlist than someone who enrolled on 4/30.

    • EXCEPTION: We will skip any senior in semester 8 because they won’t have another chance to take the class.

We recognize this situation causes many students stress and we DEEPLY regret that we cannot accommodate all enrolled students into the course as planned. EECS classes, and classroom space on campus, are both highly impacted. The result is that we attempt to find creative ways to accommodate more students and it doesn't always work out.

As this post hopefully demonstrates, staff and advisers take this situation seriously and are doing all that we can to mitigate the impact to students. Our hope is that through attrition, we will actually have to unenroll far fewer than 90 students from CS189.

 

Currently Waitlisted Students

Please check back for more information. Our first priority was to take care of students who were already enrolled to give them time to make alternate plans before the adjustment period begins. I anticipate having more information about how to handle the existing waitlisted students late Friday or Saturday. (8/10 or 8/11)
history.subject: F18: CS 189 NOT being webcast, class is over-enrolled

We recognize this situation causes many students stress and we DEEPLY regret that we cannot accommodate all enrolled students into the course as planned. As this post hopefully demonstrates, staff and advisers take this situation seriously and are doing all that we can to mitigate the impact to students. Our hope is that through attrition, we will actually have to unenroll far fewer than 90 students from CS189.

Please check back for more information. Our first priority was to take care of students who were already enrolled to give them time to make alternate plans before the adjustment period begins. I anticipate having more information about how to handle the existing waitlisted students late Friday or Saturday. (8/10 or 8/11)

 

#pin
